children.description: An individual human (natural person). Excludes non-human animals, organizations, groups, and fictional characters (see 'entity > intangible > fictional_entity > fictional_character'). Includes people of all ages and genders; use role- or occupation-specific categories elsewhere when needed.
children.label: person

children.description: A technology company
children.label: tech_company

children.description: An early-stage company
children.label: startup

children.description: A large company
children.label: corporation

children.description: A telecommunications company that provides mobile cellular network services such as voice, SMS, and mobile data.
children.label: mobile_carrier

children.description: A company that owns, operates, or franchises one or more restaurants.
children.label: restaurant_company

children.description: A company that acquires, develops, produces, and distributes published works such as books, periodicals, or digital media; manages editorial, design, production, distribution, and rights.
children.label: publishing_company

children.description: A commercial business organization
children.label: company

children.description: A governing body
children.label: government

children.description: A nonprofit organization that operates independently of government control, typically focused on social, humanitarian, environmental, or advocacy work; may operate domestically or internationally. Often considered a subset of nonprofit organizations.
children.label: non_governmental_organization

children.description: A legally organized entity that operates for a public or mutual benefit without the primary aim of distributing profits to owners. Includes charities, foundations, NGOs, associations, and other taxexempt organizations.
children.label: nonprofit

children.description: A membership organization
children.label: club

children.description: An organization that provides legal services by licensed attorneys, often organized as a partnership or professional corporation.
children.label: law_firm

children.description: An organization that provides specialized professional services (e.g., legal, consulting, accounting) to clients.
children.label: professional_services_firm

children.description: An organization that seeks to influence or control government by nominating and supporting candidates and promoting a political platform.
children.label: political_party

children.description: A higher education institution that grants undergraduate and graduate degrees and conducts research.
children.label: university

children.description: An educational institution providing secondary education, typically covering grades 9-12 (or equivalent).
children.label: high_school

children.description: An educational institution providing intermediate-level education between elementary and high school (e.g., grades 6-8 or equivalent).
children.label: middle_school

children.description: An organization that provides formal education, such as schools, colleges, or universities.
children.label: educational_institution

children.description: A musical group that performs rock music, typically including vocals, guitars, bass, and drums.
children.label: rock_band

children.description: A musical group that performs together, typically featuring multiple performers (e.g., vocals, guitars, keyboards, drums).
children.label: band

children.description: An organization whose members perform music together (e.g., ensembles, bands, orchestras).
children.label: musical_group

children.description: An organization whose members create and perform comedic works (e.g., sketch troupes, improv ensembles, stand-up collectives), typically producing live shows, recordings, or digital content.
children.label: comedy_group

children.description: A restaurant that specializes in Italian cuisine, such as pasta, pizza, and regional Italian dishes.
children.label: italian_restaurant

children.description: A business that prepares and serves food and beverages to customers for on-premise dining or takeaway; represents the establishment's operating organization, distinct from the physical premises and from parent restaurant companies or chains.
children.label: restaurant

children.description: A structured group of people with a common purpose
children.label: organization

children.description: A nation state
children.label: country

children.description: A state or province
children.label: state

children.description: A district within a city
children.label: neighborhood

children.description: A building primarily used as workplaces for businesses or organizations, containing offices and related facilities.
children.label: office_building

children.description: An educational facility
children.label: school_building

children.description: A medical facility
children.label: hospital_building

children.description: A building operated as a restaurant, where meals are prepared and served to customers. Represents the physical premises. Distinct from the operating organization; classify organizations under 'entity > organization > restaurant'.
children.label: restaurant_building

children.description: A building used for retail sales of goods to customers.
children.label: store_building

children.description: A building used for fitness and exercise activities, typically equipped with exercise machines and spaces for training.
children.label: gym_building

children.description: A small, simple dwelling or lodging, often in a rural or wilderness setting, typically constructed of wood.
children.label: cabin

children.description: A standalone residential building intended for human habitation, typically with one or more floors and a separate entrance; includes detached, semi-detached, and terraced houses.
children.label: house

children.description: A dwelling where people live; may be a house, apartment, or other residential unit.
children.label: residential_building

children.description: A structure with walls and a roof
children.label: building

children.description: A public green space
children.label: park

children.description: A shore area
children.label: beach

children.description: An elevated landform
children.label: mountain

children.description: A wooded area
children.label: forest

children.description: A path for walking or hiking
children.label: trail

children.description: A location in the open air
children.label: outdoor_location

children.description: An enclosed space within a building, typically separated by walls, floor, and ceiling.
children.label: room

children.description: An urban area
children.label: city

children.description: A small urban area
children.label: town

children.description: An administrative unit of local government (e.g., city, town, borough, commune) with defined jurisdiction and governance within a country or state/province.
children.label: municipality

children.description: One of the Earth's large, continuous landmasses (e.g., Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Europe, North America, Australia/Oceania, South America), typically defined by geographic, geological, and cultural boundaries. Use 'fictional_continent' under 'intangible > fictional_entity > fictional_location' for imaginary worlds.
children.label: continent

children.description: A place or position
children.label: location

children.description: A domesticated animal kept for companionship
children.label: companion_animal

children.description: A domesticated canine
children.label: dog

children.description: A domesticated feline
children.label: cat

children.description: A warm-blooded, egg-laying vertebrate of the class Aves characterized by feathers, wings, and beaks.
children.label: bird

children.description: An aquatic, gill-bearing vertebrate commonly known as a fish, typically ectothermic and finned.
children.label: fish

children.description: A multicellular, eukaryotic organism of the kingdom Animalia; typically motile and heterotrophic, lacking cell walls. Excludes plants, fungi, and non-Animalia microorganisms. Children may include major taxonomic groups (e.g., bird, fish), commonly recognized domesticated species (e.g., dog, cat), and role-based subsets such as companion_animal; overlap between these subtypes is expected.
children.label: animal

children.description: A raw or processed edible component used to prepare dishes or products (e.g., flour, eggs, salt). Typically not a complete dish by itself.
children.label: ingredient

children.description: A beverage made by infusing tea leaves or herbal ingredients in water; includes styles such as black, green, oolong, and herbal infusions.
children.label: tea

children.description: A beverage brewed from roasted and ground coffee beans; includes preparations such as espresso, drip coffee, and cold brew.
children.label: coffee

children.description: A liquid intended primarily for drinking (e.g., water, juice, soft drinks, coffee, tea, alcoholic drinks). Excludes liquid foods consumed with utensils (e.g., soups).
children.label: beverage

children.description: A specific prepared food item or recipe (e.g., lasagna, salad, curry). Represents the item itself, not the occasion on which it is eaten.
children.label: dish

children.description: A small portion of food eaten between or outside meals (e.g., chips, granola bar, fruit). May be packaged or prepared; generally not a full meal.
children.label: snack

children.description: A nutrient-rich liquid produced by mammals (e.g., cow, goat) consumed as a beverage and used as an ingredient; typically pasteurized and sold as whole, skim, or reduced-fat. Excludes plant-based milk alternatives.
children.label: milk

children.description: A food produced from milk or milk components (e.g., cheese, yogurt, butter, cream).
children.label: dairy_product

children.description: Edible substance
children.label: food

children.description: A pharmaceutical drug
children.label: medication

children.description: A medical procedure
children.label: medical_procedure

children.description: An intervention intended to prevent, alleviate, or cure a medical condition. Umbrella category for modalities such as procedures, medications, therapies, and other clinical interventions.
children.label: treatment

children.description: A health condition
children.label: medical_condition

children.description: A medical symptom
children.label: symptom

children.description: A medical-related entity
children.label: medical_entity

children.description: Legal rights protecting creations of the mind, including copyrights, patents, trademarks, and trade secrets; governs ownership, use, and enforcement of creative and inventive works.
children.label: intellectual_property

children.description: A formal permission or authorization defining terms and conditions for using intellectual property, content, or software (e.g., open-source, commercial, or proprietary licenses).
children.label: license

children.description: An entitlement or claim, grounded in legal or ethical principles, that permits, protects, or obligates actions or status (e.g., civil rights, usage rights, property rights).
children.label: right

children.description: A seller's or manufacturer's guarantee covering repair, replacement, or refund for a product or service within specified conditions and time limits.
children.label: warranty

children.description: A unique identifier used to send and receive email (e.g., user@example.com). Represents the identifier string, not the account or mailbox. For the account that owns mailboxes and settings, see 'digital_entity > digital_account > email_account'.
children.label: email_address

children.description: A numerical sequence assigned to a telephone line for making and receiving calls or messages.
children.label: phone_number

children.description: A platform account identifier or handle (e.g., @username) used for login or public mention on online services. Excludes offline nicknames and legal names; see 'nickname'.
children.label: online_username

children.description: Any kind of contact information.
children.label: contact_point

children.description: An informal personal name used in place of a person's given name in social or realworld contexts. Excludes platform account identifiers and handles; see 'online_username'.
children.label: nickname

children.description: Information that identifies or can reasonably be linked to an identifiable individual (e.g., legal name, government identifiers, biometric templates, device identifiers). Do not use this category for contact details such as email addresses, phone numbers, or online usernames/handles; those are modeled under 'intangible > contact_point' and its children.
children.label: personal_data

children.description: A value expressing an evaluation or preference (e.g., star ratings, scores, grades), often on a defined scale.
children.label: rating_value

children.description: A word or phrase used to address or refer to someone in conversation or writing (e.g., Mr., Dr., Sir).
children.label: term_of_address

children.description: A linguistic unit such as a word or multi-word expression with conventional meaning and usage (e.g., words, idioms, terms of address). Use children for specific lexical types.
children.label: lexical_item

children.description: A quantitative measure of length or distance expressed in units such as meters, kilometers, miles, or feet.
children.label: distance_measurement

children.description: A quantitative measure of mass or weight expressed in units such as kilograms, grams, or pounds.
children.label: weight_measurement

children.description: An eating occasion comprising one or more dishes consumed together at a particular time (e.g., breakfast, lunch, dinner). Represents the occasion, not the individual dishes.
children.label: meal_event

children.description: A scheduled occurrence with a time span (start/end or all-day), optional location, participants, reminders, and possible recurrence rules.
children.label: calendar_event

children.description: A person or person-like entity that exists only within a fictional narrative or universe.
children.label: fictional_character

children.description: A species conceived for fictional narratives or worlds, not present in reality.
children.label: fictional_species

children.description: A large landmass within a fictional world or narrative setting. Parallels the real-world concept of a continent but exists only in fiction. Parent: 'fictional_location'.
children.label: fictional_continent

children.description: A place that exists only within a fictional narrative or universe (e.g., cities, regions, worlds), not corresponding to real-world geography. Use specific children (e.g., 'fictional_continent') to model particular location types.
children.label: fictional_location

children.description: An occurrence that takes place within a fictional narrative or universe, not corresponding to real-world events (e.g., a battle in a novel, a festival in a fantasy world).
children.label: fictional_event

children.description: An entity that exists only within fictional narratives or worlds (e.g., characters, species, places) and does not correspond to real-world entities.
children.label: fictional_entity

children.description: A task or responsibility undertaken voluntarily without compensation in service of a cause, organization, or community (e.g., staffing an event, mentoring, cleanup activities). Parent: 'duty'.
children.label: volunteer_duty

children.description: An obligation, responsibility, or task that a person is expected or required to perform due to role, agreement, law, or ethical commitment (e.g., civic duties, professional responsibilities).
children.label: duty

children.description: A list of email address entries maintained for reference or for sending bulk or segmented communications.
children.label: email_address_list

children.description: An information resource that aggregates contact entries (e.g., names, email addresses, phone numbers) for reference or communication.
children.label: contact_list

children.description: Structured or unstructured content that conveys meaning, facts, or knowledge for reference, communication, or decision-making. Represents informational artifacts not tied to a specific file or software object.
children.label: information

children.description: A narrative progression or developmental trajectory that spans multiple scenes, chapters, or episodes, tracking change over time for characters, themes, or plots.
children.label: story_arc

children.description: A type of plot element representing a discrete happening that advances the narrative, causing change or consequence within the story.
children.label: plot_event

children.description: Narrative constructs that drive story progression (e.g., inciting incident, climax). Use child categories for specific plot element types.
children.label: plot_element

children.description: Abstract components used in storytelling and narratives (e.g., plot elements, character arcs). Contains conceptual, non-physical elements of stories.
children.label: narrative_element

children.description: A plan created and maintained by an individual to achieve personal goals, tasks, or schedules, possibly including timelines, resources, and milestones.
children.label: personal_plan

children.description: An intended set of actions, schedules, or steps organized to achieve goals; may include timelines, resources, and constraints.
children.label: plan

children.description: A recurring time slot that repeats weekly on specified day(s) and time(s) (e.g., every Tuesday 14:00-15:00).
children.label: weekly_time_slot

children.description: A time slot that repeats on a defined pattern (e.g., every Monday 09:00-10:00), specified by recurrence rules such as weekly or monthly.
children.label: recurring_time_slot

children.description: A contiguous interval of time with a defined start and end or duration (e.g., 09:00-10:00). Used to schedule events or availability.
children.label: time_slot

children.description: A conceptual reference to a point or interval in time used to schedule, anchor, or describe events (e.g., specific time slots or recurring patterns).
children.label: temporal_reference

children.description: An intangible entity
children.label: intangible

children.description: A tree plant
children.label: tree

children.description: A plant that produces flowers (angiosperm), encompassing species cultivated for ornamental, ecological, or agricultural purposes.
children.label: flowering_plant

children.description: A vegetable plant
children.label: vegetable_plant

children.description: A plant cultivated or used primarily for culinary, medicinal, or aromatic purposes (e.g., basil, mint, rosemary); not to be confused with the general botanical category of herbaceous plants.
children.label: herb

children.description: A plant organism
children.label: plant

children.description: A written or printed work
children.label: book

children.description: A written piece
children.label: article

children.description: A motion picture
children.label: movie

children.description: A collection of television episodes that comprise a production and release cycle within a television show.
children.label: television_season

children.description: A serialized television creative work consisting of multiple episodes, typically organized into seasons. Distinct from a single season or individual episodes; use 'television_season' for a season. Parent: 'television_work'.
children.label: television_series

children.description: An umbrella category for television creative works, including series, seasons, and related structures. Use children such as 'television_series' for the show title across seasons and 'television_season' for a specific season-level collection.
children.label: television_work

children.description: A short scripted comedic performance captured as a video, typically produced as a standalone piece or segment.
children.label: comedy_sketch

children.description: A recorded visual medium
children.label: video

children.description: A musical piece
children.label: song

children.description: A curated collection of recorded musical tracks released as a unit (e.g., LP, EP), typically by a single artist or group.
children.label: music_album

children.description: Musical composition or recording
children.label: music

children.description: An audio program
children.label: podcast

children.description: An electronic game played on computers, consoles, or mobile devices; represents the creative work/title and its gameplay content. Classify the executable program under 'software > application' and store files/assets under appropriate 'digital_entity' types.
children.label: video_game

children.description: A tabletop game played on a board, typically using pieces or cards and governed by a set of rules.
children.label: board_game

children.description: An interactive entertainment
children.label: game

children.description: A captured image
children.label: photograph

children.description: A piece of visual art
children.label: artwork

children.description: A theatrical work that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance; typically staged for live performance.
children.label: musical_theater_work

children.description: A dramatic work intended for live performance (e.g., plays, musicals, operas).
children.label: theatrical_work

children.description: A short audio cue used to alert users to an event, status change, or message in software or devices.
children.label: notification_sound

children.description: An audio recording or synthesized sound used to depict actions, environments, or events in media, games, and applications.
children.label: sound_effect

children.description: A creative work using sequential images, often with text, to tell a story or convey information; includes comic books, graphic novels, and comic strips.
children.label: comic

children.description: An audio, video, or multimedia recording of a live musical performance, such as a concert or recital.
children.label: concert_recording

children.description: A creative work that is a recorded capture of audio, video, or multimedia content (e.g., concert recordings, lecture recordings, live event recordings). Use children for specific recording types (e.g., concert_recording). Parent: 'creative_work'.
children.label: media_recording

children.description: A category for media-type creative works that are not specific to a single modality (e.g., collections or cross-modal groupings). Use children such as event_recording for specific media forms.
children.label: media

children.description: A work of creative expression
children.label: creative_work

children.description: A handheld mobile computing device with telephony, a touchscreen interface, and internet connectivity; includes devices such as iPhones and Android smartphones.
children.label: smartphone

children.description: A mobile phone
children.label: mobile_phone

children.description: A computing device
children.label: computer

children.description: A tablet device
children.label: tablet_computer

children.description: A wearable device
children.label: wearable_device

children.description: A device that relies on electronic components and circuits to operate; includes computers, mobile phones, tablets, and wearables.
children.label: electronic_device

children.description: A flat furniture surface used for storing or displaying items, often mounted on a wall or part of a shelving unit.
children.label: shelf

children.description: Furniture product
children.label: furniture

children.description: A garment worn on the upper body, typically with a collar or neckline and sleeves; may be pullover or have a front opening.
children.label: shirt

children.description: Clothing item
children.label: clothing

children.description: Household appliance
children.label: appliance

children.description: A robot designed for competitive combat (e.g., BattleBots), built to attack or withstand attacks from other robots within event rules.
children.label: combat_robot

children.description: A robot designed for competitive events (e.g., robotics competitions), optimized for rules, scoring, or specific challenges.
children.label: competition_robot

children.description: A programmable machine capable of carrying out tasks autonomously or semiautonomously, often using sensors and actuators.
children.label: robot

children.description: A stationary indoor exercise machine that simulates cycling, typically with adjustable resistance and instrumentation (e.g., cadence, power) for cardiovascular training.
children.label: exercise_bike

children.description: A powered mechanical device that performs work, often using moving parts to transmit or transform energy.
children.label: machine

children.description: A large watercraft intended for maritime transport, operations, or navigation on seas and oceans.
children.label: ship

children.description: A vehicle designed for travel on or through water, such as boats and ships.
children.label: watercraft

children.description: A means of transporting people or goods on land, water, or in the air.
children.label: vehicle

children.description: Small personal items carried or worn to hold, protect, or complement belongings (e.g., wallets, belts, sunglasses).
children.label: personal_accessory

children.description: A device or system that gathers and channels rainwater for storage or immediate use (e.g., gutters with diverters, collection heads, rain barrels).
children.label: rainwater_collector

children.description: A device used to capture and store water from natural or artificial sources (e.g., rainwater diverters, cistern inlets).
children.label: water_collection_device

children.description: Equipment designed to collect, control, distribute, or treat water for residential, commercial, or industrial use.
children.label: water_management_equipment

children.description: A physical man-made object or device (e.g., tools, electronics, furniture, vehicles, clothing). Excludes digital artifacts (see 'digital_entity') and intangible offerings (see 'service').
children.label: manufactured_object

children.description: Services delivered by trained or licensed professionals to clients (e.g., legal, consulting, accounting, architecture, engineering, design). Typically billed hourly or by engagement and do not transfer ownership of a physical good.
children.label: professional_service

children.description: A service model providing ongoing access to products, content, or features in exchange for a recurring fee (e.g., SaaS plans, streaming services, memberships). Usually billed monthly or annually and cancellable.
children.label: subscription

children.description: Essential infrastructure services that provide continuous supply of resources or connectivity (e.g., electricity, water, natural gas, internet, telephony). Often regulated and metered or usage-based.
children.label: utility

children.description: A service that enables sending, receiving, and storing email messages and mailboxes, typically supporting SMTP for sending and IMAP/POP for retrieval.
children.label: email_service

children.description: A service that sends and receives SMS (and sometimes MMS) messages programmatically via APIs or protocols such as SMPP.
children.label: sms_gateway_service

children.description: A service that enables sending or receiving electronic messages (e.g., email, SMS, chat).
children.label: messaging_service

children.description: A service that hosts calendars and events, providing scheduling, synchronization, and API/ICS access (e.g., Google Calendar, Exchange/Outlook).
children.label: calendar_service

children.description: A cloud or network service that enables creating and editing documents collaboratively or individually, often with real-time synchronization and versioning.
children.label: document_editing_service

children.description: An intangible offering delivered by a provider to perform tasks, provide access, or achieve outcomes for a customer. Includes ongoing or ondemand offerings (e.g., messaging, utilities, professional services, subscriptions). Distinguished from manufactured objects (physical goods) and standalone digital artifacts.
children.label: service

children.description: A collection of interlinked web pages and resources accessible via a domain or subdomain over HTTP/HTTPS. Represents the web presence (content and structure), not the underlying platform or application code. Excludes individual user accounts or communities (see 'group' or 'organization') and excludes the platform/software itself (see 'software > application' or 'software > platform').
children.label: website

children.description: A data storage system
children.label: database

children.description: A text document
children.label: text_document

children.description: A tabular document
children.label: spreadsheet

children.description: A slide deck
children.label: presentation

children.description: A source code file
children.label: source_code_file

children.description: A digital file or document
children.label: digital_document

children.description: A software application (executable program) that runs on a device or in the cloud. Do not use for creative works such as game titles; use 'creative_work > game > video_game' for the work itself.
children.label: application

children.description: An online platform that enables user-generated content, social networking, and interactions (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, X/Twitter).
children.label: social_media_platform

children.description: A software platform that enables real-time video and audio communication, screen sharing, and virtual meetings over the internet (e.g., Zoom, Google Meet).
children.label: video_conferencing_platform

children.description: A software platform
children.label: platform

children.description: An interface exposed by a software component or service that defines how other software can interact with it (e.g., functions, endpoints, protocols, data schemas). Includes web APIs (HTTP/REST, GraphQL), library APIs, and OS/system APIs. Represents the interface/contract, not a full application or platform.
children.label: api

children.description: A distinct capability or user-facing function within a software product (e.g., search, offline mode, dark theme).
children.label: software_feature

children.description: A software component that renders templates by combining static markup with dynamic data to produce formatted text or documents (e.g., HTML).
children.label: templating_engine

children.description: A reusable collection of code providing specific functionality through defined interfaces, intended to be integrated into applications or services.
children.label: library

children.description: A modular, encapsulated part of a software system with a defined interface and responsibility that can be developed and deployed independently.
children.label: software_component

children.description: Computer programs and systems, including applications, libraries, platforms, and tools.
children.label: software

children.description: The collection of source code files and related assets that comprise a software project.
children.label: codebase

children.description: A text corpus composed of conversational exchanges, such as chat logs or dialog transcripts.
children.label: chat_corpus

children.description: A large, curated collection of texts assembled for linguistic or machine learning analysis.
children.label: text_corpus

children.description: A dataset composed of information about identifiable individuals (personal data), often subject to privacy, security, and compliance requirements.
children.label: personal_data_collection

children.description: A dataset organized as entries for lookup or mapping (e.g., terms to definitions), intended for reference and retrieval tasks.
children.label: reference_dictionary

children.description: A dataset aggregating items from one or more feeds (e.g., RSS/Atom, activity streams), typically normalized for retrieval, analysis, or archival.
children.label: feed_collection

children.description: A structured collection of data, organized for access, analysis, or training.
children.label: dataset

children.description: A URL that provides access to join or attend a specific online meeting or conference session.
children.label: meeting_link

children.description: A URL that encodes event or calendar data (e.g., ICS download or add-to-calendar link) for adding events to calendar applications.
children.label: calendar_link

children.description: A URL or hyperlink that points to a resource or location on a digital network.
children.label: digital_link

children.description: A placeholder symbol used in templates or code, replaced with concrete values during rendering or execution.
children.label: template_variable

children.description: An organized effort to plan, develop, and maintain software, encompassing code, documentation, and processes.
children.label: software_project

children.description: A set of instructions and constraints provided to an AI system that establishes behavior, role, and boundaries prior to user inputs.
children.label: system_prompt

children.description: A textual or structured input provided to an AI system to elicit a response or behavior, often including instructions, context, or examples.
children.label: ai_prompt

children.description: A user-authored remark posted on a digital platform (e.g., website, app, social network), typically attached to a piece of content.
children.label: digital_comment

children.description: An authenticated account on an email service that owns mailboxes and settings and can send and receive email. Not the email address itself; see 'intangible > contact_point > email_address' for the identifier string.
children.label: email_account

children.description: An authenticated identity on a digital platform or system that controls access, settings, and data for a user or service (e.g., email accounts, cloud service accounts).
children.label: digital_account

children.description: A digital resource that stores calendars and events for one or more users, supporting scheduling, reminders, and sharing/sync across devices and services.
children.label: digital_calendar

children.description: A short text-based digital message sent via SMS, MMS, or internet-based messaging channels, typically between mobile devices.
children.label: text_message

children.description: A discrete communication transmitted via digital channels (e.g., SMS, chat, email), typically with metadata (sender, recipient, timestamp) and a content payload. Use child categories for specific modalities.
children.label: digital_message

children.description: An AI assistant tailored to support an individual user with tasks, scheduling, and information retrieval.
children.label: personal_assistant_agent

children.description: An AI assistant
children.label: assistant_agent

children.description: A conversational AI
children.label: conversational_agent

children.description: An AI agent specialized in retrieving, synthesizing, and citing information from reference sources.
children.label: reference_agent

children.description: An AI agent focused on transforming, cleaning, analyzing, or summarizing data rather than conversational interaction.
children.label: data_processing_agent

children.description: An artificial intelligence agent
children.label: ai_agent

children.description: A parameterized computational model trained on data to perform tasks such as prediction, classification, or generation (e.g., neural networks, decision trees, transformers).
children.label: machine_learning_model

children.description: An AI system composed of two or more agents that interact or coordinate to achieve goals. Agents may have specialized roles and communicate, collaborate, or compete within shared environments.
children.label: multi_agent_system

children.description: A computational system that performs tasks requiring intelligence such as perception, reasoning, learning, or decision making autonomously or semi-autonomously. Includes agents, trained models, and orchestrated AI pipelines.

children.description: Conceptual and logical modeling choices for representing knowledge as a graph (e.g., node/edge types, schemas, typing strategies, reification patterns).
children.label: knowledge_graph_model

taxonomy.description: Abstract ideas or categories of knowledge
taxonomy.label: concept

children.description: A person's gender identity or expression (e.g., woman, man, nonbinary). Distinct from biological_sex; values are self-identified and can be culturally and socially defined.
children.label: gender

children.description: Legal citizenship or national affiliation of a person; may differ from ethnicity or place_of_birth.
children.label: nationality

children.description: Culturally or socially defined group identity based on shared heritage, language, customs, or ancestry; typically self-identified and context-dependent.
children.label: ethnicity

children.description: Human natural language(s) used by a person, including spoken and signed languages (e.g., English, Mandarin, ASL). May include multiple values and optional qualifiers such as proficiency (e.g., native, fluent) or primary language. Excludes programming languages.
children.label: language

children.description: Calendar date on which a person or entity was born (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD).
children.label: date_of_birth

children.description: Geographic location where a person or entity was born (e.g., city, region, country).
children.label: place_of_birth

children.description: Biological classification of an organism (e.g., male, female, intersex), typically based on physical and chromosomal characteristics. Distinct from gender identity.
children.label: biological_sex

children.description: Attributes describing populations or individuals (e.g., biological_sex, gender, nationality, language, date_of_birth, place_of_birth). Often used for sociocultural or census-style profiling. Numeric measurements (e.g., age) are modeled under quantitative_property.
children.label: demographic_property

children.description: Perceived color of an object or material (e.g., red, blue) or code representations (e.g., HEX/RGB).
children.label: color

children.description: Geometric form or external outline of an object (e.g., circle, square, rectangle, irregular).
children.label: shape

children.description: Physical attributes that describe inherent characteristics of a physical entity, typically categorical (e.g., color, shape). Numeric measurements are categorized under quantitative_property.
children.label: physical_property

children.description: Amount of matter in an object, measured in mass units (e.g., kilograms (kg), grams (g), tonnes (t)). In imperial contexts, use pound-mass (lbm) explicitly. Distinct from weight_force (gravitational force), which depends on local gravity.
children.label: mass

children.description: Vertical extent of an entity from base to top, measured in units of length (e.g., centimeters, feet).
children.label: height

children.description: Lateral extent of an entity, measured in units of length (e.g., meters, feet). Typically perpendicular to height and depth.
children.label: width

children.description: Front-to-back extent of an entity, measured in units of length (e.g., meters, inches). In some contexts referred to as thickness.
children.label: depth

children.description: One-dimensional linear extent of a single entity, measured in units of length (e.g., meters, feet). Use for intrinsic measurements such as height, width, and depth. Distinct from distance (separation between entities).
children.label: length

children.description: Two-dimensional extent of a surface, measured in square units (e.g., square meters (m^2), square feet (ft^2), square centimeters (cm^2)).
children.label: area

children.description: Three-dimensional space occupied by an entity, measured in cubic units (e.g., cubic meters (m^3), cubic centimeters (cm^3)) or liters (L).
children.label: volume

children.description: Overall physical magnitude or dimensions of a single entity expressed as numeric measurements. Subtypes include length, area, and volume. Axis-specific measures (e.g., height, width, depth) should be modeled under length. Distinct from pairwise measures like distance (separation between entities). Excludes counts (see count).
children.label: physical_size

children.description: Thermal state of a system, measured in degrees Celsius (C), degrees Fahrenheit (F), or kelvin (K).
children.label: temperature

children.description: Number of discrete items or occurrences (an integer count). Excludes physical dimensions (see physical_size), monetary value (see cost), and continuous measures such as mass or volume. Examples: attendee_count, file_count, attempt_count.
children.label: count

children.description: Age of a single entity, expressed in time units (e.g., years, months). Distinct from age_difference (between entities) and date_of_birth (a specific calendar date).
children.label: age

children.description: Difference in age between two entities, measured in time units (e.g., years). Not a demographic attribute of a single entity.
children.label: age_difference

children.description: Elapsed time between a start and an end, measured in time units (e.g., seconds, hours). Includes subtypes such as age (time since birth/creation) and age_difference.
children.label: duration

children.description: Linear separation between two points or entities, measured in units of length (e.g., meters, miles).
children.label: distance

children.description: Rate of change of distance over time (e.g., meters per second, miles per hour).
children.label: speed

children.description: Monetary cost or price associated with an item or activity; specify currency and, where applicable, unit or time basis (e.g., per hour, per unit).
children.label: cost

children.description: Gravitational force acting on an object, measured in force units (e.g., newtons (N), pound-force (lbf)). Distinct from mass (amount of matter), which is independent of local gravity. Note: colloquially 'weight' is often reported in kilograms or pounds, but those are mass units; use weight_force only with force units.
children.label: weight_force

children.description: Measurable numeric attributes or quantities, including physical measures (e.g., distance, height, weight, temperature), temporal measures (e.g., duration), rates (e.g., speed), costs, and counts/amounts.
children.label: quantitative_property

children.description: Subjective evaluation of excellence or condition (e.g., low/medium/high or 1-5 stars); not referring to the methodological term 'qualitative'.
children.label: perceived_quality

children.description: Subjective assessment of how hard a task, problem, or activity is to complete or understand. Typically expressed on an ordinal scale (e.g., easy/medium/hard or 1-5). Context-dependent and distinct from computational complexity.
children.label: difficulty

children.description: Assigned order or rank for action or attention, usually defined by policy or workflow (e.g., P0-P3, high/medium/low, rank 1..n). May be informed by importance and urgency but represents a decision about sequencing.
children.label: priority

children.description: Time sensitivity indicating how quickly action is required and the consequences of delay. Typically ordinal (e.g., low/medium/high) or categorical (e.g., immediate, soon). Distinct from importance (value) and priority (assigned order).
children.label: urgency

children.description: Perceived significance or impact of an item, decision, or issue. Used to signal how valuable or consequential something is. Expressed as an ordinal level (e.g., low/medium/high) or numeric rank. Distinct from urgency (time pressure) and priority (assigned ordering).
children.label: importance

children.description: Subjective or categorical attributes that are not inherently numeric; typically ordinal scales or labels (e.g., difficulty, importance, priority, urgency, perceived_quality).
children.label: qualitative_property

taxonomy.description: Top-level container for attributes or characteristics of entities, and certain pairwise quantitative measures that compare two entities (e.g., distance, age_difference). Subdivides into demographic, physical, qualitative, and quantitative properties.
taxonomy.label: property
